title: We need Tank back in the meta, I'm sick of getting killed super fast without a frontline
body:
It's dumb not having Tanks, after realizing your adc keeps dying because they can't hide behind something.
Please bring back tanks back in the meta, WITH CC hardcore CC.

replies.body: We're going to be touching on the state of tanks in Quick Gameplay Thoughts tomorrow, and likely trying some really targeted buffs to a handful in 8.16.

We kindof need a tank item overhaul, alot of tank items are slot, and gold inefficient. There are also alot of champions like {{champion:82}} who need a little tankiness that just isn't available right now. 

For my example of morde, I used to build some defense so I could get to them, but now with defense purchase being unviable (since I still get one shot through them) I build pure damage, and am now just an ulti bot (which isn't nearly as exciting as being able to duke one out and manage my q w e cd's). 

If we had a reason to build reasonably balanced defense on multiple classes (including adc's, assassins) it would tone the game down considerably since everyone wouldn't be building pure glass cannon. 

TLDR: Please don't just choose a few tanks to make viable, please work on defense itemization.

Given the conversations around rate of change and the pain that's caused people, I can definitely say that we won't be able to do a tank item overhaul anytime soon. That being said, there might be some smaller tweaks to increase their slot efficiency that make building them feel more viable for both tanks and off tanks. Or if we're able to effectively siphon some damage from the game while not totally sacrificing lethality (not the stat) that could just naturally help with your noted problem. I do think that your Morde example is a really solid one fwiw btw.

Isn't the whole reason for tank item changes because tanks bought one item and drastically reduced the chances of killing them in lane? Even though conqueror and new last whisper exists I hope you don't attempt to swing the pendulum so far that we go back to square one.
There is also no longer starting armor/ MR with runes, so you can’t really get as tanky in lane phase. You also can’t get as tanky late game because the way the new runes work.

I honestly don't know if the rate of change is the biggest problem. I think it might have more to do with disagreement of the direction the change is taking the game. We've seen tanks get damage buffs and defense is nothing like it used to be because of the damage creep. If the game was rebalanced to have better defined classes which followed balanced damage outputs and defensive stats, while every class would have positives and draw backs to playing them, people would be more satisfied. Even if the change was drastic. We need tanks to tank and set up plays. Not 1v1 the ADC.
Thank you for finally taking the time to discuss this with the community, and for looking into ways to bring back a little sanity to this one shot meta. I know the defense community appreciates it.

I feel you should increase costs but also stats.
We need our own version of rabadons.
Old randuins and warmogs are good example. But also frozen heart could easily have it's armor doubled then a cost increase to 3000 (since armor is so ineffectual compared to magic resist)
The problem is that Riot decided to rework tanks and their items for no apparent reason and now the items are pure garbage thanks to the tank rework no one asked for.

yeah but tank stats are purposefully gold inefficient because the stat is more power than it's gold value, similar to CDR.

To put a perspective on it, Longsword is 10 AD for 350 gold while Cloth Armor is 15 armor for 300 gold.

Plus, if anything, we've learned from tank metas that tank items being so cheap is an issue and allows funneling ADCs to be easier.

Also, Mundo and Poppy are fine picks right now.

All I have to say is Gold Inefficient isn't the same as slot efficient I asked for Riot to consider both. They maybe need some tuning. 

Also, we need appropriate tradeoffs for adc's mages and assassins to have tank items. Historically they didn't lose much because their base damages were too high. 

2 picks is not the whole class.

> Also, we need appropriate tradeoffs for adc's mages and assassins to have tank items. Historically they didn't lose much because their base damages were too high.

Hmmm, no? These classes have low base damage (especially ADC) making tank items impossible for them.

> All I have to say is Gold Inefficient isn't the same as slot efficient I asked for Riot to consider both. They maybe need some tuning.

I'd like to see tank items shoot up in price, even if their stats get increased a bit, but before that I'd like Longsword and Cloth Armor to both be 400 gold. Longswords early is just a little power, and making Cloth 400 gold will make gold efficiency less misleading while also help balancing out the prices for top lane between bruisers and tanks.

You must have missed rank akali, Ekko, zed, Yasuo, talon, rengar  and etc where they still has the most damage with pure tank items. They had high base damages and could still trade well just building tank.
Season 6 ended
That season still shows the importance of trade offs, because otherwise you just get it all.
ok? tank items on assassin don't exist anymore.

You completely missed that I think it should be healthy for assassins and adcs to be able to pick up 1 defensive item. I also think it should have a trade off. For that matter I don’t think that anything being able to one shot through a defense item is healthy for this game. 

Sure one defense item shouldn’t negate the damage that an assassin deals, but I also shouldn’t be one shottable through it.
But Assassins are useless if they don't one shot, because any damage they deal is going to be healed back immediately.

False, they can still be janitors, and if it’s 2v1 because of a support, assassins shouldn’t win. If the adc is building a tank item you should be able to just prolong the fight with auto attacks without them instantly killing you.

I don't think they should win 2v1, but how can assassins be janitors without fights actually leaving people low health? Everyone is healing back to full very quickly these days, so the window for cleanup after a fight is pretty minuscule.

To be clear, I don't think Assassins need buffs or that ADC's are ok right now. I just think that the original goals that they had during the assassin reworks awhile back were good goals, and the reason "delayed burst" wasn't successful is that the current meta heavily favors frontloaded 100-0 damage. I think that reducing healing would be a good step towards changing that meta, because it would make 100-20 a more meaningful action, and would make assassins less binary.

It was more interesting than everyone just one shotting. 

Also some of those champs were building only one damage item, and still having the most damage.

saying the phrase "Sunfire Iceborn" just puts shivers down my spine

and both one-shot meta of the present and tank meta of the past are equally as uninteresting.

And iceborn is a damage item. We need defense that has an actual trade offs. 20%CDR and bonus damage on hit... that’s damage creep at work.

Sunfire stacking in season 8 probably also wouldn’t work even if it was stackable. 

Have you been reading anything I say about strategic trade offs?

Has there been any news about Wukong to pass along? How you think he's performing after his nerf, if there are any teams thinking about working on his update, ideas that you may want to try out with him or something?

No news as of right now. I personally play a fair bit of WK, and don't feel particularly great about his play pattern atm (just build pure assassin and murder any squishy dude you find), but unfortunately, my team doesn't have the time atm to take on larger work for him. If we could though, I'd be interested if we could make him more of a fighter than an assassin since I always thought he was more fun with you got to take passes on your opponent before finishing them off. Whether that's removing some of his ad scaling on abilities, giving him more hp/resists and rejigging some of his cds to account for it. Sorry, my thoughts on WK are super underdeveloped and that reply probably sounds incredibly surface level. What do you think of him in his current state?

I'm not a Wukong player, but I feel this is asking the wrong question. Up until very recently, Wukong largely felt weak and unsatisfying, with many threads on here pointing out just that. Around the time of the marksman mini-update, though, Wukong started becoming overbearing, namely because people seemed to have figured out how to abuse front-loaded burst builds using his stealth and mobility. In the end, he's still a champion many players find dissatisfying, but his core issues right now appear to stem from features like Duskblade and Electrocute, both of which have themselves earned heavy criticism. Quinn also seems to be a similar case in parallel, as she went from weaksauce to far too strong once she got to stack Stormrazor + Statikk Shiv + Duskblade for maximum front-loaded burst. Because of this, it might be better to target the offending items and runes, rather than the champions themselves, in order to make Wukong healthier in the short-term, and in a manner that won't backfire a few months down the line.

Definitely a very insightful post here by Teridax68.

Wukong is operating as a rune and item delivery system at present. Obvious concern should be that his kit is weak design wise and needs adjustment/rework.

I say this realizing you guys aren't working on it yet, but if the word gets along, I think lowering his burst damage but upping DPS is the way to go-lower ratios on Q/E with higher bases, maybe throw in some HP scaling? Increase damage ratio on Ultimate-late game it doesn't feel like it does enough. This would take away his popping capabilities, but add to his team fight strength. Upping his passive/maybe adding some sort of ratio could be good to further these ideas.
